_aLatestUpdates._sText:
General:
  • Fix music playing on round start
  • Skybox adjustments
  • Remove teleport to admin room
  • Updated entwatch for Little Sister, Big Daddy & Gene Tonics

Stage 1:
  • Elevator ladder textures missing
  • Metro ending is slightly faster

Stage 2:
  • Rare case where cohen could spawn once after dying

Stage 3:
  • Enabled fog when in exit tunnels

Stage 4:
  • First Teleport not activating for zms after bomb detonation
  • Fix nuke avoidance in water
  • Added a secondary path into Hepahestus - Normal+ difficulty

1999:
  • Added alternate path from first AFK teleport to upper-gallery

General:
* Issue where Little Sister could permanently lose her own buff
* Updated spawn imagery
* Crossfade doesn't start from silent on first song of each round
* Possible to not pick up gene tonic
* Tonics may not kill ct
* Fix gravity well slingshot
* major lighting improvements including AO and HDR
* Plasmids
    * Electro Bolt 3
        * Stun duration 5s->4.25s
        * Lifetime 62->5.5s
* Backported v6_2 logic optimisations from csgo version

* Update secret skin options

Stage 2:

Stage 4:

* Wrong timer on easy elevator doors

* Fix first AFK teleport not activating

1999:
* Adjusted first AFK teleport destination for better cover
* Columbia minor visual improvements

_sText:
Welcome to Rapture! 

It's been a long time incoming, but v6 is finally here. It includes a whole swathe of over 100 fixes and improvements, not including the visual overhaul and 2 new stages!

What is ze_bioshock?

As the name suggests, ze_bioshock is a zombie escape map themed around the underwater city of Rapture from the games series Bioshock. It features some true-to-the-original locations and layouts, as well as some custom ones, lots of custom items, and is in total around 40 minutes of content.

What features does it have?

Well, the feature list is too long to list in its entirety, so here are a few highlights:
  • 5 unique stages, spanning 4 memorable locations from Bioshock (Welcome, Fort Frolic, Arcadia, Hephaestus)
  • Difficulty scaler - the map makes itself easier if the humans are having a hard time
  • 6 player items (Plamsids) - Electro Bolt, Incinerate, Cyclone Trap, Insect Swarm, Winter Blast and Gravity Well
  • 2 player pickups (Gene Tonics) - Static Shell and Flash Flare
  • 2 zombie items (Big Daddy/Bouncer and Little Sister)
  • Multiple boss fights
  • Permanent player-independent item upgrades
  • Multiple endings

There is so much more than the above. Now would you kindly give it a playthrough!

What's new in v6?

Well, I've packed a full changelog in the map, so unpack it if you want to know it all, as there is far too much to list here. I've also included some technical documentation about how some of the cooler features of the map work, as well as some tips on how to play it better, as playthrough of v5_6 made the same mistakes over and over again. I also included a worklog spanning my day-to-day progress from start to finish of v6. While I don't expect 99% of players to look at these, the more vocal 1% may be able to make a difference.

But anyway, here are the biggest new changes in this release:
  • Complete visual overhaul, load more detail, new textures, models, sounds and particles
  • Introduced a warmup round to allow players to download/connect, combined with a redesigned spawn
  • Stage 2 has been completely reworked into a new location - Fort Frolic
  • Stage 4 only has the bomb building on Hard difficulty. It becomes a linear stage on Easy mode
  • Added a final extra-stage named 1999 (a Bioshock Infinite reference)
  • Introduced upgradeable Plasmids. Upgrades are permanent, and independant of the player using it.
  • 2 new plasmids, and 2 new item types (Gene Tonics), 2 playable zombie characters
  • Addressed a massive number of balancing issues

I want to be done with this map for good soon, so thanks for looking, and please report any bugs found.

Special Thanks:
  • 2K Games
  • Servers: i3D, GFL, UNLOZE
  • Everyone else who helped out in any way

Thank you for playing.

Hi there.

Here is my 1st map for CS:S zombie escape mod.

This map based on dungeon field of Avenir Storage from Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth1.

Includes

- 64 slots
- custom music
- custom textures
- custom models
- 4 special items for humans
- no level system
- no boss fight

Gameplay is simple. I hope you enjoy this map thanks. :D

- 5 Stages (now making stage6)
- 8 Items 
- all stages has bossfight
- including color correction

Features & stuff
==================
- A simple push gun for humans
- An ammo weapon for humans
- Napalm launcher for humans
- Rocket launchers for zombies
- Crates spawn in different areas for humans with different weapons
- Driveable vehicles
- A cannon equipped in the train
- Cubemaps
- Radar
- Color correction

Gameplay
==================
Your objective is to reach the train station, call for help and reach the pyramid as a shelter. You can make things easier by taking the helicopter on top of the station or take the train itself. Your escape area is the pyramid and you will need to defend it until someone opens the doors back where you started. You can activate the door by taking the helicopter and going on the roof or taking the train and rushing the zombies as the train makes its way.


The map should offer something a little different than your normal reach from point A to point B but that isn't for me to decide. Hopefully it brings some fun!

As a zombie, you're able to pick up rocket launchers in the second door and able to knock out people inside the helicopter! The more damage you do, the less control the helicopter has. The train has a cannon launcher as well which can **OHKO **aiming well at the helicopter blades... as well as any humans!

Changelog
==================
	b5 - Initial release.
---
	b6 - Balance changes with vehicles/items being made more cheap. New crates spawn throughout the map to help you playing as a human. Less damage from zombie items and cannonball has less range. The 'barrier' to protect you from these while holding the pyramid is bigger. Upon reaching the end as zombie you will have significantly lower health and should cut the time on killing any remaining zombies inside the pyramid. Hopefully solved the 'random' crash problems?
---
	b7 - Napalm launcher for humans, ignite and burn zombies down. Minigun available on top of the pyramid at random when a certain amount of players are connected, more zombie rocket launchers will appear as well! Helicopter extra buttons are removed now with no more cruise control settings (Players can no longer spam the buttons). Use Mouse2 when controlling the helicopter to toggle easier flying! The ceiling level is increased in the map as well given the little new feature.

#### Aperture Escape ####

Download : [BZ2](http://88.191.65.60/cstrike/maps/ze_aperture_escape_b2.bsp.bz2 "BZ2") (for wget)

In advance, sorry for my bad english.
This map starts in a test room of Aperture Science. The Mother Zombie appears after 28 seconds (map forced). He has just few seconds to cut many people before being trapped (and the others).
Then, the players go to a door that closes, and they go to escape Aperture Science. They must first activate the pistons (one goes there and the others must cover, if not : addios !). in order to climb on and reach the ladder.
Then, they had to climb up to very fast pistons. They must activate the console and cover for 25 seconds until the explosion of the pistons.
After disabling the other pistons, they discover the most difficult room of the map : there will be many dead and zombies).
Indeed, they will climb the pistons to reach and climb the ladders. Humans have 50 seconds before the release of zombies, or 10 seconds if one go in the top.
Moreover, a small course on pipes (be careful : no fall into the water) with piston and cover point.
The map end in a lift where humans must prevent the zombies to climb in, followed by a slow rise with the song 'Cara Mia', the turret choir of Portal 2.
The map is punctated with french voice of Cave Johnson.

Français :

Description complète :
Cette map débute dans une salle de test de Aperture Science. Le zombie mère apparaît après 28 secondes (forcé par la map). Il a juste quelques secondes pour cut un maximum de personnes avant d'être mis en prison (lui et les autres).
Les joueurs se dirigent alors vers une porte qui se ferme et ils se retrouvent dans les confins de Aperture. Ils doivent en premier lieu activer les pistons (un seul y va les autres covers sinon adios), pour pouvoir grimper dessus et atteindre l'échelle.
Ensuite, un petit parcours assez simple pour les faire grimper jusqu’à de nombreux pistons très rapides. Ils doivent activer la console et cover pendant 25 secondes, jusqu'à l'explosion des pistons.
Après la désactivation de deux autres piston, vient la salle la plus dur de la map : il y aura de nombreux morts ou zm.
En effet, il faudra grimper sur des pistons en mouvement pour atteindre les échelles. C'est pas facile, on peut se faire écraser ou tomber (les humains on 50 secondes pour monter avant la libération des zombies, sauf si un humain atteint le haut, ils ont alors 10 secondes).
Ensuite un petit parcours sur des tubes (attention à ne pas tomber dans l'eau) avec un piston a désactivé et un point de cover.
La map se termine dans un ascenseur où les humains doivent empêcher les zombies de monter dedans, suivit d'une montée lente au rythme de "Cara Mia", la musique de fin de Portal 2.
La map est ponctuée de phrases idiotes de Cave Johnson.

______________________________________________________________
***---___===++++OLD LOOK AT THE FINAL2 VERSION++++===___---***
--------------------------------------------------------------


The most massive Portal Themed map ever made!

The Sixth release of my Aperture Science series! An Expansion on the Fourth release

In this universe, Aperture science simulates combats, in this case a zombie escape. Some experiments have gone wrong, and a few test subjects have turned into zombies! Finish the puzzles before the zombies and reach surface to get cake at the end!

Why? You might ask, do Aperture Science goes through all of this trouble? The answer is simple, for the people who are still alive!

This is a Zombie Escape map, in which humans try to get out of Aperture Science before the infected try to convert them! Pass all of the puzzles and run through the offices to find GLaDOS and survive the final horde while she dies. Then reach the surface where you will get cake (I am not lying! I promise!)

The design of this map is greatly inspired by the game Portal, and it has many similarities with the game, along with some test chambers and look alike textures, which leads me to the features of this map

NEW FEATURES
-Alternative routes, because YOU asked for it!
-Remember the turrets? They are here, they shoot and you can gun theme down
-Improved textures, now it looks more like Portal itself
-New gameplay elements
-Added an easier to look ball
-Added a few more details
-Optimized map
-Easier for Cts to defend now from incoming zombies
-Fixed the blocking elevator issue
-Did I mentioned that it is more MASSIVE than ever?

This is version 2 (Fixes may still happen if necessary so feedback from you is still important)and if you notify me of one, stay tunned for the updated version
Please send your issues and improvements, any feedback is greatly encouraged! As I actually dont forget my maps

Developed by Eugenio 'Motanum' Roman
Bugs, comments, suggestions to agent_2114@hotmail.com

If you take this map for your server online DONT FORGET TO SEND ME YOUR I.P. address so I CAN JOIN along!

More maps from me to come

Special thanks to Uber Micro Forums for their support and guidance.
Sponsored by ]Hell[ Servers

See screenshots

Installation, just paste the all of the files in the ZIP on your maps folder for counter strike source

Default should be Files\Steam\steamapps\Account_Name\counter-strike source\cstrike\maps

This map is broken with the new Update for CSS
I am working on an update, expect it in about 2 weeks time
About 17 of july of 2010
UPDATE NEWS END HERE

In this universe, Aperture science simulates combats, in this case a zombie escape. Some experiments have gone wrong, and a few test subjects have turned into zombies! Finish the puzzles before the zombies and reach surface to get cake at the end!

Why? You might ask, do Aperture Science goes through all of this trouble? The answer is simple, for the people who are still alive!

This is a Zombie Escape map, in which humans try to get out of Aperture Science before the infected try to convert them! Pass all of the puzzles and run through the offices to find GLaDOS and survive the final horde while she dies. Then reach the surface where you will get cake (I am not lying! I promise!)

The design of this map is greatly inspired by the game Portal, and it has many similarities with the game, along with some test chambers and look alike textures, which leads me to the features of this map

FEATURES
-Explore my recreation of Aperture Science
-Hear GLaDOS talk to you as you try to survive
-Incinerate the companion cube! or rescue its smaller twin
-Do you have what it takes to carry the cake around and survive?
-Get one of the 4 Portal guns! (Just for looks, it doesnt shoot portals)

This is the final version (Fixes may still happen if necessary so feedback from you is still important)
Please send your issues and improvements, any feedback is greatly encouraged!

This map can be a bit challenging and it may seem a bit confusing to run through the offices, Just FOLLOW the cake arrows, it will give you a general idea of where to go.

I started making this map about a week and a half ago, on and off. I wanted to do the map as a follow-up of my other recent ZE map Taboo Carnation but, instead of starting over from the first level no matter what, I wanted to have a Life system like in Contra or similar run 'n gun games. I felt tired of the map, however, and just completed it as a normal ZE map with no items and no bosses.

The gameplay should be rather straightforward. The map contains 3 chapters, each of them increasingly hard (I hope) with built cubemaps and ambience. The music is different for each chapter too, and so is the path. 

I might do a new version soon including the life system and a 'hard' mode for once it is beaten with less lives for starters and little or no one-ups appearing.

Everything should work but, as I don't trust myself and vehicles in source are a bit messy, if the ending chopper kills you I am not to blame.

---------

The chapters are:

 - I : Ascension
 - II : A touch of heaven
 - III : The womb

On the first two chapters you advance towards the core of the fortress and to the mountain side so you can see the entire continent below. The third chapter, being the opposite, is all about getting down and rushing out to get the chopper.

The estimated lengths of each chapter if you aren't pants-on-head level dumbo is 6:45, 6:30 and 7:45 minutes:seconds respectively. If you surpass that limits by more than 1 minute you should seek medical assistance or, better yet, a well trained neurologist.

---------

I might release the .vmf with the next/final version. You're allowed to decompile and do whatever you wish with the map. I don't like being creditted, please don't do it. 

This map contains no particles that can be stolen, so you can't get custom.pcf, map_weapons.pcf or map_details.pcf from here. Life's tough for you if you wanted to claim them as yours.

---------
### CUSTOM CVARS
### ____________
(Fake cvars that can be added to a config file for the map; they work as a normal cvar but they communicate with the map and let you modify how it works)


**antartika\_force\_stealth**

 Forces the map to always run on Infiltration mode. 
 
 NPCs will spawn, although the map will not change much aside from that
 since the NPCs should be enough of a difficulty boost anyway.

 Take note that Chapter 3 has those vents that hurt you if you jump straight...
 
**blizard\_mode\_enable and blizard\_mode\_disable**

 Enable/disable the blizard -hard- mode. Blizard mode adds a bit of difficulty
 by applying multipliers on zombie classes.

 Muultipliers applied:

 	Health: 	4.0
	Speed:		1.05
	Knockback: 	0.8

 The multipliers can be modified by writing your own blizzard_overwrite.cfg file.

 The mode also features a few visual changes (CC, clouds) and environmental (thunder sounds)

Ze_aftermath_v2

Made by:
Sherlock Holmes[NL]

AKA:
Xyr1c0n[NL]
SnarkY
Spoon7of7doom

About the map:
The objective of the map is to reach the end-point and to stay alive until the explosion kills all the people who didn't
make it. 

There are several barricades where you can hold of the zombies so your team can make progress through the map.

Also I'm not a full-time map creator so don't expect to much of this map, also it's my first zombie escape map so I'm not
sure how balanced everything is.

Enjoy the map and don't use anything without my permision (you can use my map as a example).


New in this version:
-Added various props to make it harder to reach the tram
-Added some new rooms to extend the duration of a round
-Added HDR support
-Added traps
-Added some destructable barricades that block doors
-Made some flickering lights non-flickering
-Made the tram-area more easy to defend
-Fixxed some texture problems
-Fixxed some spawnpoints

Hey guys, Aero here, with my very first map, like ever.

Hope you guys will like this map, because I certainly had a fantastic time making it. It was a little frustrating, but I am pleased with what came out. 

Sorry for the net_graph in the screenshots, I forgot to turn it off, but they really don't cover anything important, so I don't think it's a big deal. Sorry if it offends some people. :P




SPECS:
This is a 48-man escape map. 

This map will start you out in front of a strange white building. It's your first real test of courage. Which platforms are solid? Which ones break? Will you fall into the poisoned water? Well, I guess you're just going to have to find out the hard way.

(Note: the wall on the entry side is a ladder for you to exit the water. I'm not that cruel)

Then you have to face the first labyrinth. It's pretty tame, not too difficult. Reach the center and be whisked to the next task.

The center teleport will carry players to a randomly selected labyrinth. There are three in total. Players will need to navigate these labyrinths and make it to the ending point, where they will be treated to some alcohol, and some dance music--complete with a stripper pole for your enjoyment.

(PROTIP: To get into the stripper box, shoot the area above the television set, then enter the door next to the bar. To exit the stripper box, well, there's an exit sign.)

Or, if you choose to hide from the zombies, parking it deep within the labyrinths is a good way to do it. You might die from the nuke, but at least you didn't turn into a zombie.

Though I have not pictured it here, there is also a secret "safe zone" that can be accessed from two points on the map. Though, you will need to find those on your own. I don't reveal my secrets!




Time to give credit where credit is due.

SPECIAL THANKS:

Helix - for all the time he spent testing my map and telling me what I needed to fix, and for helping me with a large portion of it. He is super cool, yo!

Westsid3r - for the nuke prefab I used (http://www.fpsbanana.com/prefabs/1848)... it came in handy, because I know I couldn't have done it myself. 

And finally, my friends over at the Huggable Gaming ZM server (8.9.15.203:27015) for testing all 6 previous versions of my map. Sorry for all the trouble.



HOOPLAH! :) that's about all there is to it. Download and enjoy.

sorry, im on a deadline so my screenshots come from my bugs and fixes file.

This map is made and released for the STEAMGAMERS gaming community 2012 mapping competition

So the layout goes something like this;

Humans make a dash for the center lab area, here the zombies cant get past the anti zombie security systems.

Humans will then need to branch out to danger areas in order to activate various generators and security systems, eventually clearing the way to the surface elevator allowing them to escape. Most danger areas, feature cat walks and other high areas, allowing humans to knock zombies down and away from them, with teamwork what seems impossible may very well only be improbable.

At times multiple objectives will be up at once, and it will be up to the players to decide in what order they wish to tackle them.

The next to last objective is kind of a mini game, failure can cause death for anyone who tries to complete it. If the humans take to long doing it, or are unable to, then they will simply be overrun by zombies.

This map features a side objective where you must obtain food for the escape, otherwise a nasty surprise awaits.....

in an attempt to clear up any confusion, ive included a grainy walkthrough! plz check it out if you have any questions about the objective structure. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5MOX6FX8kpI&feature=youtu.be

Finally ready the initial version of my map "abandonedbase" in this version I brought several changes since the structure of the map to the entities of the map. The history of the beta version that was "one base on a bottom of the sea" no longer applies, because we change the end of the map, is now based on a secret military base that was destroyed by a deadly virus. Good. I will cite some changes on the map:

- Added more ammo in the guns of the map.
 
- The doors never close.

- Time nuke is activated when it gets close to the boats.

- FOG and SkyBox map have changed.

- Buttons of the doors that did not work in another room, now work.

- New changes in the structure of the map.

- Brightness of the map changed.

- Balancing entire map.

- Reduced time.

- Light marking the buttons on the map.

- Power Room Door opens automatically.

- Improvements on the map.

- Anti AFK on the safe room.

- Power Room have new structure.

- The nukes have shake now.

- New means of escape.

- Base TR and CT are now together and their structures were modified.

- Was removed the time of 15 seconds the engine room on the second part of the map.

The map has more changes that can only be seen playing the map. Anyway ... I hope you enjoy the map, any bugs please contact me xD

In a total of a 2-3 month project, we finally finished the map 2012 with two mappers and much help of others.

The story: You begin in a bunker and you have to make your way to the city. Once in the city, dodge buildings, and others. You'll have to walk in into a large building to get acces to the airplane. There are several alternatives and holdspots. Once inside the plane, humans should go inside the cockpit, zombies inside the cargo. A bit later, they will crash into a snow area and they will have to make their way to the sea where the ark is. The ark is the final fight.
Programs used: Photoshop Cs4 VtfEDIT SourceSdk Audacity

This is the newest version, with added difficulties and a by far better optimized cityscene. Prefered zombie spawn time: 8:30.

ze_13 - Was the save file but liked the name so kept it. A zombie escape map based on a mix of running and holding.

How to play - Add players and that's it.

No horrible clipping.

No over powered weapons to stop zombies.

No zombie blockers.

No real way for them annoying team mates to kill you or get you trapped.

No cheap teleports to save campers, you either escape or die.

It's a fair map based around the players doing the work, working together and over comming the challanage. If I could control it I would have the zombies winning this map more then the cts, no challange in the game if as a ct you win non stop.

If you want to run to the end of the map and set off the nuke without seeing a single zombie or go and find a secret weapon that unbalances the map behond playable, fun conditions, then I think this isn't the map for you !

64 Spawns.

Average FSP 350 (ATI HD5670 512mb, AMD7850 2GB DDR2 666MHZ RAM- 19" LCD)

Optimized.

Compiled on NORMAL using valves compiler.

Cubemaps compiled.

AFK/SPAWN CAMPING killer after 60 seconds of the games round.

Flashlights are disabled due to a dark room.

Teleports parented to the elevators so people wont be bugged in to the brush work.

Zombie friendly triggers that enable walk ways and break blockades.

Random breakable items at the safe zone, 1 per round so it can make the safe zone a little more difficult to protect.

No known bugs.

I hope people enjoy it and that's its fun !


V2 Edits.

Spawn - All gates now breakable, was some that had the flag "Only break on trigger" so fixed that.

Saftey door now is sligly different in design so zombies don't get caught against it and die when it opens.

Saftey door opens 3 seconds later giving ct's slighting more time to deal with the jumps in the water room and the light room.

Prop_static trash physic changed to "non solid"

----------------------------------------------------


Light room is very simple, you stand on a light pressure pad, it lights up and also enables a sprite, all you need to do is then get to that sprite by means of jumping.
I won't edit that room in this version as I think people just need to get used to it, the idea is that people learn how it works rather then making it too easy and simple.
If it's still a problem after a while then in v3 I shall change it.

Thanks for the feedback so far, it's been taken in to account !

Hope there isn't any bugs in this version.
